## Scraping
In this part scrape AMAZON products and collections.

- When user gives URLs so find which platform and after scrape according to platform.

- Amazon: 
  1.Uesr can gives collection and products URLs
  2.If Collection url first extrct HTML content and Extrct all Product links and one by one scrape that product
  3.If User gives product URLs so scrape directly. Like: HTML Content by HTTP -> Get all information about product

## Wayfair Scraping 
**Double click** to edit me. [Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/sticky-notes/)

options.systemMessage: ou are a Competitor Data Analyzer for the rugs industry. Inputs: wayfair_product (JSON): full Wayfair product catalog record (title, sku, price, images[], description, categories[], specs, dimensions, launch_date, current_promotions, historical_prices[], ratings_summary, reviews[]). competitor_data[]: array of competitor product records (Amazon). Task (strict): Produce a single HTML document (complete ...) as the only output. Do not output any plain-text analysis outside the HTML. The HTML must implement the Style guide (Typography, colours, spacing, table styles) supplied below exactly. Deliverables inside the HTML: A) Competitive Landscape Report — for each competitor (Amazon): Rows/columns: Product launches (dates/categories), Pricing changes, Reviews & ratings (avg rating, review volume, sentiment summary), Marketing content (campaign name, reach, avg engagement). Provide both a human-readable table. B) Benchmark summary: a concise table comparing Wayfair vs. each competitor on key KPIs: - Price position (cheaper / parity / premium) - Avg rating & review velocity - Promotions frequency (monthly %) C) Insight Summary: - Whitespace opportunities where Wayfair can win (clear bullets, actionable). - Key gaps in competitor strategy (short bullets). - Actionable recommendations for Wayfair (prioritized, tactical). Styling & rules (must follow EXACTLY): Use the provided Style guide — Project Outputs (Typography, font weights, exact hex colours, spacing, table CSS). The document must use Inter font (via Google Fonts or local fallback). Headings and body sizes must follow the guide. Tables must use the 2-column attribute style for attribute areas and the th/td styles provided. All numeric formats: price with currency symbol and two decimals (e.g. $129.00); dates as YYYY-MM-DD. Accessibility: ensure contrast ratios, readable font sizes. HTML features (must include): A top-level H1 with product title and meta (category, launch date). A single-column layout with product attributes table at the top. Benchmark tables (one per competitor) collapsed by default and expandable. Insight Summary section with 3 subsections: Whitespace opportunities, Key gaps, Actionable recommendations (each as numbered bullets). All tables must have captions and small caption text styled as Inter 11px #6B7280. Output: ONLY return the full HTML document without any noisy data. Do not append any commentary or text outside the HTML. Make sure show only that data is available. Do not include any image elements (, , background-image) or placeholders for images. Skip the images section entirely. Don't want to show any machine readble data, JSON or any things. Style guide — Project Outputs (append exactly as provided to the LLM for reference): [Include the exact style guide block you provided to me—typography, colours, spacing, table templates, formatting rules, small editorial rules.]

parameters.content:
## Analyze data :
By LLM analyze competitor data and get analysis report
